top_categories.workout_context: Pickerel Buck40’s wi countryside, rolling gravel demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Pickerel Buck40 isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Pickerel Buck40’s wi rolling gravel and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Pickerel Buck40 rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Pickerel Buck40 when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Pickerel Buck40 — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Pickerel Buck40’s wi rolling gravel drains energy reserves faster than the distance suggests — durability training bridges the gap.
The varied gradients at Pickerel Buck40 reward climbing adaptability — knowing when to sit, when to stand, and when to switch.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Pickerel Buck40 — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on wi rolling gravel.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Pickerel Buck40. Make this intensity feel like home.
Muscular force work builds the torque for headwinds and wi rolling gravel at Pickerel Buck40 — when you can’t spin, you grind.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Pickerel Buck40 count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Pickerel Buck40’s 40 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Pickerel Buck40 requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on wi rolling gravel to build confidence. Expect: wi countryside, rolling gravel, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and VO2max to prepare you for 40 miles of wi rolling gravel in Wisconsin.
